00040 #ifndef PHYSEVENTUSERINPUT_H
00041 #define PHYSEVENTUSERINPUT_H
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 // This will expose all keyboard and mouse, joystick and other userinput events
00044 // to developers, we are using the SDL keymap to get us started, large portions
00045 // are directly copy/pasta'd, so we included their license too
00046 ///////////////////////////////////////

00048 //From SDL

00072 #include <vector>
00073 
00074 using namespace std;
00075 
00076 #include "physevent.h"
00077 #include "physdatatypes.h"
00078 #include "metacode.h"
00079 
00080 
00081 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00082 /// @class PhysEventUserInput
00083 /// @headerfile physeventuserinput.h
00084 /// @brief This is a container for MetaCodes that is used in the physEventManager
00085 /// @details The PhysEventUserInput is the container for information about how a
00086 /// user enters data and commands into a program. By Default one is inserted into
00087 /// event manager the with all the user input from the last run of the main loop.
00088 /// These can be manually inserted into the EventManager to simulate input from
00089 /// other sources. If setup properly this can allow computer controlled
00090 /// characters to use the same interface players, allowing for more realistic
00091 /// response from them. This is not limited to the tricks discussed here.
00092 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00093 class PhysEventUserInput : public PhysEvent
00094 {
00095     private:
00096         //Thse both accept a specific king of RawEvent from SDL and will behave non-deterministically if
00097         //passed any other kind of data.
00098         void AddCodesFromSDLMouseButton(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00099         void AddCodesFromSDLMouseMotion(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00100 
00101     protected:
00102         vector<MetaCode> Code;
00103 
00104         public:
00105         /// @brief Default constructor
00106         /// @details This creates a perfectly functional, but empty PhysEventUserInput.
00107         PhysEventUserInput();
00108 
00109         /// @brief Single Data Point constructor
00110         /// @param Code_ This MetaCode will be added to the PhysEventUserInput during creation.
00111         /// @details This creates a functional PhysEventUserInput which already contains one metacode.
00112         PhysEventUserInput(const MetaCode &Code_);
00113 
00114         /// @brief Multi Data Point constructor
00115         /// @param Code_ The MetaCodes in this vecotor will be added to the PhysEventUserInput during creation.
00116         /// @details This creates a ready to use PhysEventUserInput which already contains all the metacodes included.
00117         PhysEventUserInput(const vector<MetaCode> &Codes_);
00118 
00119 
00120         virtual ~PhysEventUserInput();
00121 
00122         //code managment functions
00123         /// @brief Single Data Point constructor
00124         /// @param Code_ which Metacode to return.
00125         /// @return Index The requested MetaCode
00126         /// @details This function simply retrieves the requested MetaCode. It can throw standard Out of bounds exceptions if attemped to reference a negative item or an item with Index higher than what exists
00127         /// \n This is useful for accessing each MetaCode stored in this physUserInputEvent.
00128         const MetaCode GetMetaCode(const unsigned int &Index);
00129 
00130         /// @brief Retrieves a count of the stored Metacodes
00131         /// @return The amount of codes stored in this physEventUserInput.
00132         /// @details
00133         unsigned int GetMetaCodeCount();
00134 
00135         /// @brief Adds a MetaCode
00136         /// @param Code_ The User Input MetaCode tobe added
00137         /// @details This adds an existing metacode to this event.
00138         void AddCode(const MetaCode &Code_);
00139 
00140         /// @brief Adds a Created From Raw Values
00141         /// @param MetaValue_ The MetaValue that will be in the MetaCode
00142         /// @param ID_ The ID that will be in the MetaCode
00143         /// @param Code_ The InputCode that will be in the MetaCode
00144         /// @details This creates metacode a metacode and adds it to this event.
00145         void AddCode(const int &MetaValue_, const short unsigned int &ID_, const MetaCode::InputCode &Code_);
00146 
00147         /// @brief Adds a MetaCode created from a RawEvent
00148         /// @param RawEvent_ The RawEvent which will be translated into exactly One MetaCode
00149         /// @details This will add MetaCode to this event which will be create from a RawEvent which can produce Exactly one MetaCode. This is used by engine internals, it is
00150         /// recommended to not use this in game code.
00151         /// @warning Do not use this without reading and fully understanding the warnings on MetaCode::MetaCode(const RawEvent &RawEvent_) . This function has all the same
00152         /// Restrictions. If game code is using RawEvents at all, the game logic should be scrutinized carefully, it is probably wrong, but if it must it should use
00153         /// PhysEventUserInput::AddCodesFromRawEvent instead, as it can make the needed determinations automatically and in a platform agnostic way.
00154         void AddCode(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00155 
00156         /// @brief Add Several MetaCodes from a vector
00157         /// @param Codes_ A vector of MetaCodes to be added to this event
00158         /// @details This adds several existing metacodes to this event.
00159         void AddCode(const vector<MetaCode> &Codes);
00160 
00161         /// @brief Adds all possible MetaCodes that can be created from the given RawEvent
00162         /// @param RawEvent_ The RawEvent which will be translated into a group of metacodes and added to this
00163         /// @details This will add MetaCode to this event which will be create from a RawEvent which can produce Exactly one MetaCode. This is used by engine internals, it is
00164         /// recommended to not use this in game code.
00165         /// @warning If game code is using RawEvents at all, the game logic should be scrutinized carefully, it is probably wrong, but if it must them this is the correct
00166         /// function to use. This will work same on a all platforms. However, the binary format of the Rawevent could chnage meaning you would have to recompile the game code to work
00167         /// with new version of the engine
00168         /// \n This Function is currently incomplete, and does not yet process all events such as joysticks events and some mouse events.
00169         void AddCodesFromRawEvent(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00170 
00171         /// @brief Removes a specific code from storage.
00172         /// @param Code_ This will search for all matching copies of this
00173         /// @details All MetaCodes that are equal to Code_ will simply be erased.
00174         void EraseCode(const MetaCode &Code_);
00175 
00176         /// @brief Removes a specific code from storage.
00177         /// @param Index This is the location to removed from
00178         /// @details The MetaCode at and only at the given Index will be deleted.
00179         void EraseCode(const unsigned int &Index);
00180 
00181         /// @brief Removes a specific code or Adds it if not present.
00182         /// @param Code_ This will search for all matching copies of this.
00183         /// @details All MetaCodes that are equal to Code_ will simply be erased.
00184         void ToggleCode(const MetaCode &Code_);
00185 
00186         /// @brief This add all of one PhysEventUserInput to another
00187         /// @param Add is the PhysEventUserInput on the right hand side of +=
00188         /// @details This simply copies all the MetaCodes from one PhysEventUserInput to the other.
00189         /// @return The PhysEventUserInput on the left ahnd side will now contain a set of both items MetaCodes
00190         PhysEventUserInput& operator += (const PhysEventUserInput& Add);
00191 
00192         /// @brief Returns the type of this event
00193         /// @return Returns EventType::UserInput
00194                 virtual EventType getEventType();
00195 };
00196 
00197 
00198 #endif
